title: Imperial system aside, is there any alternative to the metric system? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, there is. USCS. The United States customary system. It is not Imperial. It is older than Imperial, older than Metric CGM or MKS or metric SI. It is used by over 300 million people regularly and by one very large leading industrialized nation that has even used it to put men on the moon, something not accomplished by nations using metric as their primary system. Not that it couldn’t have been done with metric but demonstrates that it is a completely functional system. Most educated scientific and engineering people in the world are at least passingly familiar with it and it is completely and precisely defined in terms of the same reference standards as used by nations using the metric system.

US Customary Units. It’s what we use here in ‘murica. Edit to add: Oh, yeah. There’s another obscure system I’ve heard about called The International System of Units, often abbreviated as SI. It is loosely based on the metric system and was invented on the planet Remulak, by the Coneheads - who later immigrated to France. I’ve heard it is useful in cooking and stuff. All of the people who use SI units suffer from obsessive compulsive disorder and insist on well-documented yet counter-intuitive rules around spaces, commas, decimal points, and CaPiTalizATiON. And they hate ’murica. I tried to use it for cooking once, but the stupid “mass-meter” I purchased was actually a cleverly disguised strain gage, and instead of outputting in newtons (or is it Newtons) (or is it kg*m*s^-2) its output was in grams! Go figure. Anyhoo, some people must find it useful, but I don’t care for it much.
